CatDescriptText: Mrs. Willa Mae Bonner, 1931 Brighton Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "No, I don't think that they are spending too much time watching television.  For my family, most of the watching is done by the small kids add there is not too much that they can get out of the programs."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Willa Mae Bonner, wearing light colored boucle coat with oversized buttons, holding piece of paper, standing with arms folded in front of block wall with store windows on either side, one with sign reading "Telegram Send Flowers Worldwide" on right
